title: Ticket #6916: CREAM update for OpenSSL 1.1.0 causes crashes
description:
In 8.6.13, we patched the CREAM source code (and its dependencies) so that it would build against OpenSSL 1.1.0. We now have multiple reports that those changes cause the CREAM code to crash on RHEL7 (OpenSSL 1.0.x). We need to either fix or remove the patch.

Since the latest version of the CREAM client library doesn't build against OpenSSL 1.1.0, it seems reasonable to say we won't try to patch it to do so.
check_ins: 2019-Feb-15 11:17   Check-in [56196]: Disable CREAM support on systems with OpenSSL 1.1.0 or greater. #6916 The CREAM client library doesn't build with OpenSSL 1.1.0. Our attempt to patch it lead to crashes when using OpenSSL 1.0. So we've reverted the patch and now refuse to build CREAM if OpenSSL is too new. (By Jaime Frey )
